result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael F. Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael F. Sanders is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael F. Sanders was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or 9 days KCJ with huber or 9 days on work crew.
TIME SERVED  -  Expungment hearing on 7-15-16 @ 9:00 am.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael F. Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Carl Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  No action taken on expunction request.
Satisfaction of Commitment - Deft completed work crew in lieu of fine and costs
Ct. 2
Ct. 1
30 days to pay or 9 days KCJ with huber or 9 days on work crew
time served

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson. Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 39 days KCJ.  Credit for 39 days served.  Costs ordered.  30 DTP.  In default, 9 days work crew or 9 days KCJ.  Expungment hrg 7/15/16 @ 9am.  DNA ordered; notice provided to deft.
deft was not produced from KCDC for today's hrg; hrg has been adj to 7/15/15 @ 1:15pm.  Conveyance notified; ADA Drees notified in court & Atty Carl Johnson notified in court

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Carl Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  State objects to deft's bond reduction motion.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion.  Motion taken under advisement with a bias towards granting the motion.  (Court is inclined to allow the deft release under house arrest if deft resides w/his grandparents).  Defense counsel may contact the clerk to obtain a sooner FPT date/continued bond motion date.  However, defense counsel informed that one or both of the grandparents will need to be present.  Court will also want the deft produced from the jail.  Per Atty Johnson - he will email the clerk later this afternoon.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
